alert.note: Alert for Briscoe (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 5:34PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Briscoe County through 600 PM CDT... At 533 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Brice, or 15 miles north of Caprock Canyon State Park, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Briscoe County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
